main event: A watchman at the K-25 area in Oak Ridge, Tennessee reported seeing a round, silvery object the size of a basketball at a very high altitude in the southwest sky on June 15, 1958.
interesting points: The object was observed for about 3 minutes.
The object appeared to be traveling at a high speed and faded out of sight.
The sighting was reported to various military commands and evaluated as possibly being an aircraft at high altitude.
Winds aloft and balloon launch information from the area was requested to help investigate the sighting.
A diagram showed the object's flight path from northeast to southwest, with the sun low on the horizon at the time of departure.
result: possibly an aircraft at high altitude
sighted object: round, silvery object the size of a basketball
